page.title: 02LANDSCAPE, POSTLING
page.content: The dominant feature of this area is the steep slope of the land at the ridge of the Downs & the change from the mixed farming landscape on the clay & sandy soils to the grass land of the chalk Downs. The highest point at Farthing Common,595ft,gives extensive views over the Channel, to France & the Atomic Station on Dungeness promontory, over the new buildings of Ashford into Sussex. Its height and unprotected north & east aspects make this a cold & windy area. In common with other districts in the extreme south east, it can often be more affected than the rest of the British Isles by continental weather. Although the sea tempers winters cold, the wind can still burn off the winter wheat on stretches of the larger fields.
